title: Bring back the Rock, Paper, Scissors, Lizard, Spock metas - PLEASE!
body:
Once upon a time, it was:
1.  (Rock) The job of marksmen was to tear down the tanks and towers.  
2. (Paper) The bruisers and assassins had the job of destroying the marksmen.
3. (Scissors) The tanks had the job of being the front line, guarding the marksmen from the bruisers and assassins.  They, like the bruisers and assassins, were slow at taking down towers.
4. (Lizard) The mages had the job of doing the damage to the tanks when they built too much armor.
5. (Spock) The supports had the job of keeping the squishy mages and marksmen alive until the late game.

Can we get this back please?

Now hold on a second here.

So, you say that marksmen's only job is to be tank killers. Alright, that's all find and dandy...until you look at the rest of the roles.

If only marksmen are supposed to be tank killers, then what about bruisers? I thought that was also supposed to be their job -- I mean, we gave them a tailor-made keystone *precisely* for the purpose of killing tanks. But then they also are supposed to be able to function as off-DPS champs, and should be able to take down squishy classes (like our friend the marksman) because, well, they're squishy (hmmmm, seems they're a little target agnostic. Now wasn't that something everyone complained about for a certain other class?).

And of course, we can't forget our DPS mage friends. They are *also* supposed to be the mages that are masters of tank busting -- and they are, don't get me wrong -- but again, they are great at being squishy killers.

So currently, that's an entire other class *plus* a sub-class that are supposed to be tank killers. But also they are great at killing squishy champions and functioning as DPS carries. Oh, and because of buffs to AP's turret taking in addition to Blue Elixir which has made AP better at turret taking whenever it's bought, they fulfill every niche that marksmen used to cover.

So: if you had to take a pick between a class that excels at only **one** thing, but has to spend more gold then other classes in order to do it, and takes them an entire item inventory as well *OR* you can pick one (or another!) that is *at minimum* good, if not in some cases great at several things, **including** the one that the first class is supposed to be best at, which would you choose?

I need to chip in here -one small quibble...

If we go back far enough, the rise of the bruisers were initially caused by the rise of Black Cleaver (hence, the "League of Cleaver" meta which nearly busted the game back in Season 3).  And bruisers initially were not in the beginning supposed to be able to overcome tanks that easily - hence, the jungler's role was to help them win lane.  (I like to think it is one reason why the complaining toxic Riven main meme came into being.)

Before the Cleaver, lest we forget, it was a case that a tank could beat a bruiser if the bruiser was stupid enough to go toe to toe while they were in lane.  The jungler rose in significance in getting the Rivens, Dariuses, etc., out of lane so they could wreak their havoc on other lanes.  But when the Cleaver was introduced (see https://www.thescoreesports.com/news/13511-how-did-this-happen-league-of-cleavers for more), nearly all elements of tactics and strategy were thrown out the window - LoL became a game run by a single item.  (And to be honest, we are nearly in that state again - except it is not one item, rather it is the same effect caused by that item - the rise of a "true damage" meta.)

Unfortunately, that brief interval brought in quite a few bruiser players who love their respective champs (and I can't blame them really).  But to get back to that point, the answer is no - bruisers were not supposed to beat tanks easily.

The turret thing isn't so much a problem as it is a side effect of the mechanics of the game. Ignoring exceptions, the only way to damage turrets are through auto attacks and, for reasons I hope I don't need to explain, champions who built AD, AS, and were ranged really got the maximum bang for their buck in that area. It's like saying having Junglers and Supports are a "problem" in this game because team comps designed themselves around maximizing 3 streams of gold (Jungle wasn't that much of a viable gold stream in the earlier versions of League). People finding solutions to these elements in League's designs aren't problems; they're literally solutions to the problems. 

Anyway nitpicking aside, there's a strong argument to be made for the specialization of champions in League, _especially_ in how we're waaaaay over 100 champions already and it'd be entirely pointless to have all of them do the exact same thing. If we're going to homogenize the general strength of taking down towers, how should that square with champions with abilities specifically designed around killing towers like Ziggs and Tristana?

Actually, in the past, if any lane is and has been poorly performing, then the game could be tilted very easily in favour of one side or the other.  

I've seen games lost when the mid, top or jungle fell behind.  The botlane just got the blame in the past because some of the metas have strongly favoured camping and farming kills on that lane.  Moreover, some of the laners at lower tiers have had a tendency to get tunnelvision on their lanes and not notice what was happening elsewhere until they suddenly realized that the game was over.  (Remember that commonly quoted line about toplane being an island?  Case in point.)

Even the queen in chess can be rendered insignificant -whether by sacrifice, neutralization or capture - depending on the position and the tactics/strategies present on the board. 

However, let's not put bruisers in the same class as a chess queen.  But if we must: the queen has a clear value in chess; bruisers however are right now completely overvalued and worth more pawns in some people's minds than they should be.

Because of "diversity", we've let things get so vague that we now have assassin-supports, mage-bruisers, assassin-bruisers, mage-assassins, tank-bruisers, and tank-bruiser-assassins.  The mind just boggles.  

The blurring of the lines has led the game to become one ugly mess.  ANd this is because it has morphed far beyond the rock-paper-scissors-lizard-Spock analogy to nearly Nth level complexity.  And when you add so many tiers of complexity, one cannot be surprised that some champions are becoming grossly imbalanced and so easily...

League is a MOBA which is used to be actually complex and the fact that the basic segmentation of roles boggles your mind is problematic because it's not an FPS, not it should be in anyway.
